intro: Catimbium haenkei, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its flowers are bell-shaped with five lobes. Catimbium haenkei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
